body:
to clarify two capabilities that may be not obvious: 
Train Set Estimates means that the classifier can (if asked) estimate its performance on unseen data during the training process. This could be through bagging, or by using the estimates through some internal tuning.
Contracted: this means you give the classifier a maximum build time, and it will do the best it can in that time limit.

nice!

The great thing would be the ability to automatically generate this table, and display it on sktime.org, along the lines of #704.
that is a good idea, I'll raise a specific issue

issue.title: Refactor tags

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
* use of "capabilities" rather than "tags" in classification module
* unclear naming of `_all_tags` method
* inconsistent tags for composition algorithms (see #977)
* integration in `all_estimators` function to make them usable in finding/filtering models

**Describe the solution you'd like**
* refactor capabilities into tags
* rename `_all_tags` to `get_tags` and make public
* add tag kwarg to `all_estimators`
* add tests to catch inconsistent tags

body: @fkiraly If I am not wrong here, is this kinda extension to **Automated learning algorithm overview**? Thanks.

>@fkiraly If I am not wrong here, is this kinda extension to Automated learning algorithm overview?

Correct, on the docs side.

Under the hood, we also need a consolidated tags system, as in #981, with the registry retrieval/query functionality that @mloning proposed.

adding to this is to add Cababilities (soon to be tags) to classifiers without them, including [ColumnEnsembleClassifier, ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier, IndividualBOSS, IndividualTDE, ProximityStump, ProximityTree]

issue.title: Classifiers capabilities tags Issue #996

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs

Fixes #996 .

<!--
Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

This PR generates a summary of the capabilities of different classifiers. The main list of classifiers included showing their capabilities tags. 
For clarity, some utility classifiers, such as ColumnEnsembleClassifier, ComposableTimeSeriesForestClassifier, IndividualBOSS, IndividualTDE, ProximityStump, ProximityTree, are not included as they miss such tags.


#### Does your contribution introduce a new dependency? If yes, which one?

<!--
If your contribution does add a new hard dependency, we may suggest to initially develop your contribution in a separate companion package in https://github.com/sktime/ to keep external dependencies of the core sktime package to a minimum.
-->

#### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

This PR generates csv file with the summary of the capabilities of classifiers. Kindly note below,

1. Below command is not used as it throughs an error with the compatibility of fbprophet.
           from sktime.utils import all_estimators
2. Some utility classifiers miss the capabilities tags which I am focusing to implement in next PR.

#### Any other comments?

I would really be grateful if you could spare some time to review and approve it. @mloning @TonyBagnall @ABostrom 

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [Y ] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [Y ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [ ] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

##### For new estimators
- [ ] I've added the estimator to the online documentation.
- [ ] I've updated the existing example notebooks or provided a new one to showcase how my estimator works.

Thanks for contributing!
-->
